How about the absolute lack of sustain without items?
Or the fact that all her damage is physical?
Or maybe because she's really squishy?

Champions like Darius and Mordekaiser completely destroy her right now up in the top lane, and any late game scaling bruiser/tank will tell you just how negligible her damage is once you get some armor items.
No counter play.... besides armour stack, CC, better duellers and poke.

Weaknesses: Low end base resistances/hp and near-lowest sustain of any physical bruiser. Clear engage patterns and threat windows. High vulnerability to hard crowd control and silence due to reliance on small windows of opportunity and life steal based survivability.

Frankly, Riven is a very exploitable champion with very clear weaknesses and quite a large amount of counter-play. She is strong despite those weaknesses and counter potential, but the onus is on you outplay.

If you want a champion example of what a lack of counterplay entails, think of Annie and read the paragraph again. And yet few people would argue that Annie isn't balanced.
